channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [WFLY-5568] Concurrent access timeout -- could not obtain lock within 5000 MILLISECONDS
item.description:
This problem happens in a seemingly innocent scenario: standalone EJB client invoking method on a stateful bean in the first "forwarding" cluster (2 nodes), this bean just forwards the call to a stateful bean in the second "target" cluster (2 nodes), and then back again. Invocations are serial; the client won't invoke a method on a bean until it got a response to previous invocation. During the test, one of the target servers is shut down, which is when the problem starts to appear.

This is the exception we're seeing on the standalone client:

2015/10/20 19:28:54:958 EDT [ERROR][Runner - 13] HOST perf17.mw.lab.eng.bos.redhat.com:rootProcess:c - Error getting response. <javax.ejb.EJBTransactionRolledbackException: WFLYEJB0228: EJB 3.1 FR 4.3.14.1 concurrent access timeout on RemoteStatefulSBImpl - could not obtain lock within 5000 MILLISECONDS>
 
        javax.ejb.EJBTransactionRolledbackException: WFLYEJB0228: EJB 3.1 FR 4.3.14.1 concurrent access timeout on RemoteStatefulSBImpl - could not obtain lock within 5000 MILLISECONDS

item.summary: Concurrent access timeout -- could not obtain lock within 5000 MILLISECONDS

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Fixed by WFLY-5617
